examples.romaji_meaning: Senaka (Back) ni nimotsu (luggage) o seowimasu (carry on back)
examples.english: I carry luggage on my back.

examples.romaji_meaning: Hada (Skin) ga kansou shite imasu (is dry)

examples.english: It is good for the skin.

examples.sentence: 順番に並んでください
まともな仕事が欲しいです
examples.romaji: Matomo na shigoto ga hoshii desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Matomo (Respectable) na shigoto (job) ga hoshii (want) desu (is)

examples.sentence: まともな人間になりたいです
examples.romaji: Matomo na ningen ni naritai desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Matomo (Respectable) na ningen (person) ni naritai (want to become) desu (is)
examples.english: I want to become a respectable person.

examples.sentence: サイズがぴったりです
examples.english: The size is a perfect fit.

examples.sentence: この服は私にぴったりです
examples.romaji: Kono fuku wa watashi ni pittari desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) fuku (clothes) wa watashi (me) ni pittari (perfect fit) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 思わず笑ってしまいました
これより、あれがいいです
examples.romaji: Kore yori, are ga ii desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kore (This) yori, are (that) ga ii (good) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 彼より私の方が背が高いです
examples.romaji: Kare yori watashi no hou ga sei ga takai desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kare (Him) yori watashi (I) no hou (way) ga sei ga takai (height is tall) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 食べ物を捨てるのはもったいないです
examples.romaji: Tabemono o suteru no wa mottainai desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Tabemono (Food) o suteru (to throw away) no wa mottainai (wasteful) desu (is)
examples.english: It is wasteful to throw away food.

examples.sentence: 最新の情報は何ですか？
examples.romaji: Saishin no jouhou wa nan desu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Saishin (Latest) no jouhou (information) wa nan (what) desu ka (?)
Yume (Dream) o akirame masen (will not give up)
examples.english: I will not give up on my dream.

examples.sentence: この曲を聞くと懐かしい気持ちになります
examples.romaji: Kono kyoku o kiku to natsukashii kimochi ni narimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) kyoku (song) o kiku (to hear) to natsukashii (nostalgic) kimochi (feeling) ni narimasu (becomes)
examples.english: Hearing this song makes me feel nostalgic.

examples.sentence: 地図が場所を示しています
examples.romaji: Chizu ga basho o shimeshite imasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Chizu (Map) ga basho (place) o shimeshite imasu (is showing)
examples.english: The map is showing the location.

examples.sentence: 時間たっぷりあります

examples.english: What is the continuation of the story?

examples.romaji_meaning: Goukei (Total) wa ikura (how much) desu ka (?)

examples.sentence: 怪我をしました。傷が痛いです。
examples.romaji: Kega o shimashita. Kizu ga itai desu.
examples.romaji_meaning: Kega (Injury) o shimashita. Kizu (Wound) ga itai (hurts) desu (is).
examples.english: I got injured. My wound hurts.
I apply medicine to the wound.
My condition is bad. / I don't feel well.
